sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: We-Inn Llc Sells 252,502 Shares of Innventure (NASDAQ:INV) Stock
feed.summary: We-Inn Llc recently sold 252,502 shares of Innventure (NASDAQ:INV) stock for a total value of $1,181,709.36, decreasing its position by 3.95%. This sale on December 18th is part of a larger trend of selling by We-Inn LLC since October, involving millions of shares. Innventure shares recently traded down to $4.35 after reporting weaker-than-expected Q3 earnings, though analysts maintain a "Buy" rating with a $14 price target.

feed.title: We-Inn Llc Sells 184,777 Shares of Innventure (NASDAQ:INV) Stock
feed.summary: We-Inn LLC sold 184,777 shares of Innventure (NASDAQ:INV) on December 17, 2025, for approximately $898,016, reducing its stake by 2.81%. This sale is part of an ongoing insider selling trend by We-Inn, which disposed of about 2.64 million shares between October and December, generating around $10.5 million. Innventure's stock dropped 8.6% to $4.35 following the news, alongside a significant earnings miss and negative margins.

feed.title: Innventure, Inc. (NASDAQ:INV) Receives Average Recommendation of "Buy" from Analysts
feed.summary: Innventure, Inc. (NASDAQ:INV) has received an average "Buy" recommendation from five analysts, with a mean 1-year price target of $14.00. Despite this, the company reported weak earnings, negative margins, and significant insider selling, though institutional ownership remains high. The stock currently trades around $4.89, with weak liquidity ratios.

feed.title: Innventure, Inc. Added to Russell Indexes
feed.summary: Innventure, Inc. announced its inclusion in the Russell 2000®, 3000®, and Microcap® Indexes, effective December 22, 2025. This inclusion is expected to enhance the company's visibility and broaden its shareholder base, reflecting progress in achieving strategic goals. The Russell indexes serve as key benchmarks for investment managers globally.

feed.title: Innventure, Inc. Added to Russell 2000® and Russell 3000® Indexes as of December 22, 2025
feed.summary: Innventure, Inc. announced its inclusion in the Russell 2000®, Russell 3000®, and Russell Microcap® Indexes, effective December 22, 2025. This move is expected to increase the company's visibility within the investment community and broaden its shareholder base. CEO Bill Haskell highlighted this milestone as a recognition of Innventure's progress in transforming breakthrough technologies into scalable businesses.

feed.title: Innventure Set to Join the Russell 2000, Russell 3000, and Russell Microcap Indexes
feed.summary: Innventure, Inc. (NASDAQ: INV) announced its inclusion in the Russell 2000, Russell 3000, and Russell Microcap Indexes, effective December 22, 2025. CEO Bill Haskell stated that this inclusion marks a significant milestone, enhancing Innventure's visibility and broadening its shareholder base as it focuses on transforming breakthrough technologies into scalable businesses. Membership in these indexes is determined by market capitalization and style attributes and is widely used for benchmarking and index funds.

(NASDAQ:INV) will be included in the Russell 2000 and Russell 3000 Indexes effective December 22, 2025, an important milestone reflecting the company's progress and strategy execution. feed.title: Innventure, Inc. Added to Russell 2000® and Russell 3000® Indexes as of December 22, 2025

feed.title: Daniel Hennessy Sells 55,840 Shares of Innventure (NASDAQ:INV) Stock
feed.summary: Daniel Hennessy, a Director at Innventure (NASDAQ:INV), sold 55,840 shares of the company's stock for over $289,000, reducing his position by 6.84%. This sale follows Innventure missing its quarterly earnings and revenue estimates, causing the stock to drop by about 6%. Analyst sentiment for Innventure is mixed, with an average "Buy" rating and a $14 consensus price target, but also a "sell (e+)" rating from Weiss Ratings.

feed.title: Innventure approves stock issuance to comply with Nasdaq
feed.summary: Innventure has approved the issuance of new stock to satisfy Nasdaq's listing requirements. This move signals the company's commitment to maintaining its public listing status and meeting regulatory standards.

feed.title: Innventure Approves Stock Issuance to Comply with Nasdaq
feed.summary: Innventure (INV) stockholders approved two proposals on December 2, 2025, to issue 20% or more of the company's common stock for convertible debentures with Yorkville, ensuring compliance with Nasdaq Listing Rule 5635(d). This strategic move will impact the company's capital structure and market standing, despite an analyst rating of "Hold" with a $5.00 price target, and a "Neutral" AI analyst assessment from TipRanks due to poor financial performance and an unattractive valuation.

feed.title: Innventure (NASDAQ:INV) Major Shareholder We-Inn Llc Sells 172,589 Shares
feed.summary: Innventure (NASDAQ:INV) major shareholder We-Inn Llc recently sold 172,589 shares of the company’s stock for a total of $821,523.64. This transaction reduces We-Inn Llc's holdings to 6,572,561 shares, representing a 2.56% decrease in their position. The sale is part of a series of large disposals by We-Inn Llc since October, amidst the company reporting a quarterly EPS loss and missing revenue expectations, though analysts maintain a "Buy" rating.

feed.title: Innventure stockholders approve proposals for convertible debenture share issuances
feed.summary: Innventure Inc. (NASDAQ:INV) stockholders have approved two proposals to issue common stock related to the conversion of convertible debentures. The approvals at a special meeting on Tuesday concern issuances to YA II PN, Ltd. (Yorkville) and are in compliance with Nasdaq Listing Rule 5635(d). The company's stock has experienced high volatility, and Innventure recently reported a Q3 2025 net loss of $34.7 million, with a positive outlook for its Accelsius division.

feed.title: Shareholder We-Inn LLC Sells 717,791 ($3.6M) Of Innventure Inc [INV]
feed.summary: Shareholder We-Inn LLC has sold 717,791 shares of Innventure Inc [INV] between December 1-3, 2025, for a total value of approximately $3.6 million. Each share was sold at a price of $5.00, and this transaction leaves We-Inn LLC with 6,572,561 direct holdings. The insider trading activity was disclosed via a Form 4 filed with the SEC.

feed.title: Innventure (NASDAQ: INV) to join Sidoti and Northland virtual investor conferences
feed.summary: Innventure (NASDAQ: INV) announced its participation in two virtual investor conferences in December 2025. Roland Austrup, Chief Growth Officer, and Lucas Harper, Chief Investment Officer, will present at Sidoti's Year End Virtual Investor Conference on December 11th and attend Northland’s Virtual Growth Conference on December 16th, where they will be available for investor meetings.

feed.title: Innventure We-Inn LLC sells $3.5m in INV stock
feed.summary: Innventure We-Inn LLC, a 10% owner of Innventure, Inc. (NASDAQ:INV), has sold 718,791 shares of common stock for approximately $3.5 million. These transactions, occurring between December 1 and December 3, 2025, coincide with high price volatility for INV stock, which is down over 52% in the past year. The company's financial health is rated as WEAK, though Innventure reported a net loss of $34.7 million in Q3 2025, it maintains a positive outlook for its Accelsius division and recently appointed a Lead Independent Director to strengthen corporate governance.

feed.title: Innventure to Participate in Upcoming Investor Conferences
feed.summary: Innventure (NASDAQ: INV) announced its participation in two upcoming investor conferences in December 2025. Roland Austrup and Lucas Harper will present at Sidoti's Year End Virtual Investor Conference on December 11th and attend Northland’s Virtual Growth Conference on December 16th for investor meetings. The company is focused on commercializing breakthrough technologies to build companies with billion-dollar valuations.

feed.title: Innventure (INV) creates Lead Independent Director role, updates pay
feed.summary: Innventure, Inc. (INV) has established a new Lead Independent Director role and appointed Bruce Brown, an existing independent director, to the position. This role carries an annual retainer of $30,000, payable quarterly in cash or fully vested common stock. The changes are detailed in a prospectus supplement to Form S-1, incorporating a recent Form 8-K.

feed.title: Innventure (NASDAQ: INV) sets Nov. 13 results release; conference call at 5 p.m. ET
feed.summary: Innventure (NASDAQ: INV) will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results after market close on November 13, 2025. Management will host a conference call on the same day at 5:00 PM ET to discuss the results, which will be webcast live via the company investor relations site.

feed.title: Innventure, Inc.'s (NASDAQ:INV) last week's 21% decline must have disappointed individual investors who have a significant stake
feed.summary: Individual investors hold the largest stake in Innventure, Inc. (NASDAQ:INV) with 32% ownership, and were significantly impacted by last week's 21% stock decline. Insiders own 29% of the company, while the top five shareholders control 51% of the business. The article highlights that private equity firms also have a notable ownership of 14% and influence the company's strategic direction.

feed.title: Innventure, Inc.'s (NASDAQ:INV) market cap up US$41m last week, benefiting both retail investors who own 32% as well as insiders
feed.summary: Innventure, Inc.'s (NASDAQ:INV) market cap increased by US$41 million last week, positively impacting both retail investors, who own 32% of the company, and insiders, who hold a 29% stake. The top five shareholders collectively control 51% of the company, with retail investors being the largest group. Institutional investors and hedge funds also hold stakes, indicating professional interest in the company.

feed.summary: This article contrasts Innventure (NASDAQ:INV) and Katapult (NASDAQ:KPLT) across various financial metrics and analyst recommendations. Katapult, however, has higher revenue and earnings.

feed.summary: Innventure, Inc. has hit a new 52-week low of $2.80, reflecting a significant 72.57% decline over the past year despite reporting strong net sales and profit growth earlier this year. The microcap company in the miscellaneous industry faces challenges including an alarming return on equity and consistent underperformance compared to the S&P 500. With a market capitalization of $304 million, Innventure continues to struggle in the current market landscape.

feed.title: Accelsius Introduces NeuCool® MR250, Unlocking At-Scale Two-Phase, Direct-to-Chip Cooling for AI and HPC - Stock Titan
feed.summary: Accelsius has launched NeuCool® MR250, its first row-based Coolant Distribution Unit designed for two-phase, direct-to-chip liquid cooling in AI and HPC data centers. Debuting at the OCP Global Summit, the MR250 provides 250 kW of liquid cooling capacity per rack, reducing the need for constant water treatment associated with single-phase systems. This solution aims to improve energy efficiency, enhance reliability, and simplify data center operations, with initial deployments already underway.

feed.title: Innventure (NASDAQ:INV) Director Sells $32,014.15 in Stock
feed.summary: Innventure Director Daniel Hennessy sold 6,265 shares of the company's stock for a total of $32,014.15, reducing his ownership by 0.52%. Despite the sale and significant Q3 losses, Innventure's stock rose 11.2% to $5.05. Institutional investors are increasing their positions, now holding 55.98% of the stock.

feed.title: Q&A with Lucas Harper, Chief Investment Officer, Investment Committee of Innventure
feed.summary: Lucas Harper, Chief Investment Officer at Innventure, discusses the firm's unique "Closed Loop Model" for building companies in collaboration with multinational corporations. This model aims to mitigate startup risks and accelerate growth by leveraging existing patented technologies from MNCs. Harper highlights successful ventures like Accelsius and Refinity, emphasizing Innventure's role in commercializing innovation with a focus on early-stage economics and later-stage risk profiles for investors.

feed.title: Innventure, Inc. Announces Strategic Developments in Accelsius' Liquid Cooling Solutions for Data Centers
feed.summary: Innventure Inc. announced significant advancements for its subsidiary Accelsius, including a three-year master purchasing agreement for liquid cooling solutions and the launch of a new 250Kw multi-rack cooling system. Accelsius has also demonstrated the capability to cool 4500Ws per socket, doubled its workforce, and is experiencing rapid global adoption of its technology, highlighting its leadership in refrigerant-based liquid cooling for data centers.

feed.title: Innventure subsidiary acquires rights to advanced plastics recycling technology
feed.summary: Refinity, a company launched by Innventure Inc., has acquired global licensing rights from VTT Technical Research Centre of Finland for its proprietary fluidized bed advanced plastic scrap conversion technology. Refinity plans to use this technology to commercialize the conversion of mixed plastic scrap into chemical precursors for petrochemical production, focusing on hard-to-recycle plastics and aiming for higher yields and lower CO2 emissions than conventional methods. The initiative will be led by Innventure's CTO Bill Grieco as Refinity's CEO and Adam Javan as COO, with plans to integrate manufacturing plants with existing petrochemical operations.

feed.title: INV Stock Price and Chart — NASDAQ:INV
feed.summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of Innventure, Inc. (INV) stock performance, key financial metrics, and company information. It includes current stock price, historical price changes, market capitalization, earnings data, employee numbers, and analyst forecasts. The company focuses on transforming technologies from multinational corporations into standalone businesses.

feed.title: Accelsius Secures $24M in Series A Funding to Efficiently Cool AI Data Centers
feed.summary: Accelsius has successfully raised $24 million in Series A funding, led by Innventure, to advance its two-phase liquid cooling systems for AI data centers. The company's NeuCool system aims to improve energy efficiency by 50% and enhance rack power density tenfold, addressing the increasing energy demands of AI. This funding will support Accelsius' U.S. operations, international expansion, and team growth.

feed.title: AeroFlexx Delivering Innovative Packaging to Meet Rising Demand for Sustainable Liquid Packaging Solutions
feed.summary: AeroFlexx has announced the first delivery of its innovative AeroFlexx Paks from its commercial production facility. These lightweight, flexible packages are designed to act like rigid bottles, offering a sustainable and convenient solution for liquid packaging. Founded by Innventure, AeroFlexx is scaling its production globally to meet rising demand across various industries.

feed.title: Jonathan Loeffler: Thrilled to announce that Innventure, an Ascent Capital Partners portfolio company, has successfully gone public!
feed.summary: Jonathan Loeffler, Co-Founder and Managing Director of Ascent Capital Partners, announced that Innventure, a portfolio company, has successfully gone public through a SPAC merger with Learn CW Investment Corporation. This milestone marks a significant achievement for Innventure, praised by Loeffler for its groundbreaking innovations and future potential. Ascent Capital Partners expressed pride in being part of Innventure's journey and looks forward to their continued success.

feed.title: Innventure completes merger, debuts on Nasdaq as INV
feed.summary: Innventure Inc. has completed its merger with Learn CW Investment Corporation and will begin trading on the Nasdaq Stock Market under the ticker symbol INV on October 3, 2024. The company, which specializes in commercializing transformative technology solutions, aims to offer investors access to early-stage economics with late-stage risk and has a track record of building companies, including PureCycle Technologies, Inc. Financial metrics suggest Innventure trades below its book value with a market cap of $9.14 million.
